snippet: Abu al-Majd, who fought with government forces, also struck up a relationship with Times correspondents. Then he was sent to Palmyra, and disappeared.
abstract: Reporter's Notebook; New York Times reporters recount their efforts to discover what happened to missing Syrian police officer Abu al-Majd, who had been communicating with them since April 2014 in effort to give an insider's look at life in war-torn country; learn that Abu al-Majd was beheaded by Islamic State militants in May 2015 after he was sent to Palmyra, Syria, to fight.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

lead_paragraph: Abu al-Majd, who fought with government forces, also struck up a relationship with Times correspondents. Then he was sent to Palmyra, and disappeared.

headline.print_headline: From Syrian Officer, an Insider’s Look at War. Then, Silence.
headline.main: Syrian Officer Gave a View of War. ISIS Came, and Silence Followed.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
